headline: Lululemon Founder Outraged Over See-Through Leggings: 'A New Low'
summary: Lululemon Athletica, Inc. (NASDAQ:LULU) founder Chip Wilson has launched an attack on the company's board of directors, labeling recent quality control issues with the brand's product lines as a “new low” for the yoga-wear giant. In a viral LinkedIn post, Wilson — who stepped down from the company years ago but remains its largest individual shareholder — did not hold back. He pointed directly to the board's management as the root cause of what he describes as see-through leggings and declining

headline: Lululemon under fire: What it needs to get back on track
summary: Lululemon (LULU) is under fire for quality control issues, just ahead of CEO Calvin McDonald's departure at the end of January.Lululemon received a barrage of customer complaints about a too-sheer style of leggings. The company has since removed the leggings from its website.Barclays consumer discretionary analyst Adrienne Yih joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre to discuss Lululemon's history of product issues and what the future looks like for the company.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: Lululemon under fire: What it needs to get back on track
content.description:
Lululemon (LULU) is under fire for quality control issues, just ahead of CEO Calvin McDonald's departure at the end of January.

Lululemon received a barrage of customer complaints about a too-sheer style of leggings. The company has since removed the leggings from its website.

Barclays consumer discretionary analyst Adrienne Yih joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre to discuss Lululemon's history of product issues and what the future looks like for the company.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
content.summary: Lululemon (LULU) is under fire for quality control issues, just ahead of CEO Calvin McDonald's departure at the end of January.Lululemon received a barrage of customer complaints about a too-sheer style of leggings. The company has since removed the leggings from its website.Barclays consumer discretionary analyst Adrienne Yih joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre to discuss Lululemon's history of product issues and what the future looks like for the company.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
